message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a deep neural network architecture for modeling Egocentric Spatial Memory (ESM) for robotic control in real applications. The paper involves computer vision (CV) techniques for estimating occupancy state of the world and constructing top-down 2D global maps from egocentric views. It also involves artificial intelligence (AI) techniques for updating belief of the global map based on local observations using a recurrent neural network and augmenting the local mapping with a novel external memory. The paper also involves machine learning (LG) techniques for learning to predict free space based on egocentric views efficiently in an end-to-end manner. Finally, the paper involves robotics (RO) techniques for dealing with continuous actions and states, which is vitally important for robotic control in real applications.
